title: Noteworthy
text:

Image 1 of 2 FILE - This is a Feb. 4, 1975, file photo showing New York Knicks basketball player Neal Walk, in New York. Neal Walk, a tough center on the early Phoenix Suns teams who became an inspirational speaker after losing the use of his legs, has died at age 67. The Suns confirmed his passing in a statement on Monday, Oct. 5, 2015. Phoenix drafted Walk as the No. 2 pick overall in 1969 after losing the coin flip with Milwaukee to draft Kareem Abdul-Jabbar (then Lew Alcindor). The 6-foot-10 Walk also played for the New Orleans Jazz and New York Knicks in his eight-year NBA career. (AP Photo/Ron Frehm, File) ORG XMIT: NY162
Photo: Ron Frehm FILE - This is a Feb. 4, 1975, file photo showing New York Knicks... Image 2 of 2 SAN JOSE, CA - APRIL 20: Raffi Torres #13 of the San Jose Sharks celebrates with Mike Brown #18 after he scored a goal in the second period of their game against the Los Angeles Kings in Game Two of the First Round of the 2014 NHL Stanley Cup Playoffs at SAP Center on April 20, 2014 in San Jose, California. (Photo by Ezra Shaw/Getty Images) ORG XMIT: 485355655
Photo: Ezra Shaw SAN JOSE, CA - APRIL 20: Raffi Torres #13 of the San Jose Sharks... Noteworthy 1 / 2 Back to Gallery Torres' ban 41 games for illegal hit to head
NEW YORK — San Jose Sharks forward Raffi Torres will miss half the season and lose more than $440,000 in salary after being suspended by the NHL on Monday for a hit on Ducks forward Jakob Silfverberg.
The league said the 41-game suspension without pay was for interference and an illegal check to the head against Silfverberg during the first period of a preseason game in Anaheim on Saturday. Torres was assessed a match penalty for the illegal check to the head.
Based on his average annual salary, Torres will forfeit $440,860. The money goes to the Players' Emergency Assistance Fund .
Torres has played just 12 regular or postseason games the past two years because of knee injuries.
Soccer: South American Football Confederation vice president Rafael Esquivel of Venezuela has been denied bail on health grounds as he fights extradition to the U.S. after being indicted in the FIFA bribery case. One of seven soccer officials arrested in Zurich in May, he is currently in a hospital in Switzerland. At the time of his arrest, the 68-year-old was president of the Venezuelan federation he has led since 1988. He has since been replaced by an acting president.
Courts: Former New England Patriots receiver Irving Fryar , who played in the NFL from 1984 to 2000, has been sentenced to five years in prison for his role in a mortgage scam. His mother, Allene McGhee , was sentenced to three years' probation in the case.
Obituary: Neal Walk , a center on the early Phoenix Suns teams after they drafted him No. 2 overall in 1969, has died at age 67. Walk had health problems over the years and his condition deteriorated in recent weeks. He underwent surgery 28 years ago to remove a tumor on his spine. Phoenix lost a coin flip with Milwaukee and drafted Walk behind Kareem Abdul-Jabbar (then Lew Alcindor ). Walk also played for the New Orleans Jazz and the New York Knicks in his eight-year NBA career.
— Wire reports
